meanings.definition: The state or condition of being free from being observed or disturbed by other people.
meanings.sent1: I value my privacy and enjoy spending time alone in my room.
meanings.sent2: She closed the door to her room for some privacy while she worked on her project.
meanings.sent3: The cat demanded privacy by hiding under the bed when the guests arrived.
meanings.sent4: The garden provided a sense of privacy with its high walls and lush greenery.
meanings.sent5: The privacy of the forest enveloped her in a peaceful embrace.

meanings.definition: The right to keep one's personal matters and relationships secret.
meanings.sent1: He respected her privacy and never asked intrusive questions.
meanings.sent2: She was grateful for the privacy laws that protected her personal information.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel insisted on privacy for its nut-burying activities.
meanings.sent4: The diary was a sanctuary of privacy where she poured out her thoughts.
meanings.sent5: The privacy of their conversation was guarded behind closed doors.

meanings.definition: The quality or state of being secluded from the presence or view of others.
meanings.sent1: The cabin in the woods offered complete privacy away from the city noise.
meanings.sent2: The high walls of the castle provided privacy for the royal family.
meanings.sent3: The penguin waddled away for some privacy on the icy shore.
meanings.sent4: The fog wrapped the town in a blanket of privacy, hiding it from view.
meanings.sent5: The privacy of the mountain peak made it a perfect spot for meditation.
